channel.title: Custom resolution
channel.description:
So I am curious. I know that you can't make it MORE THAN the pixel amount of your lcd monitor. Is there a way to make it a smaller size. For example, most computers have an 800x600 resolution. I am wanting to make a 600x600 or something like that.
I've done some google searches but haven't found anything useful.There has to be a file that tells the vga driver what to allow and what not to.

item.title: Custom resolution
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

Loveandpower:

[quote]if you’re using window, the default controls won’t help you much. try seeing if your video card has a control panel.

It’s a very basic card panel. - select the default resolution(s) , make a hotkey for a few items,etc etc.

Nothing about custom resolutions though[/quote]
that’s odd, ATI and Nvidia are usually know for having pretty well-tuned panels (especially with higher end cards)… what’s your card?

Read full topic

item.title: Custom resolution
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

if you're using window, the default controls won't help you much. try seeing if your video card has a control panel.

It’s a very basic card panel. - select the default resolution(s) , make a hotkey for a few items,etc etc.

Nothing about custom resolutions though

Read full topic

item.title: Custom resolution
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

Loveandpower:

That’s what I thought but how do I go about making a custom resolution? My graphics driver does not have a “make a special resolution” option

if you’re using window, the default controls won’t help you much. try seeing if your video card has a control panel.

someone2:

It’s not something you can easily do. You’d have to mod your graphics drivers.

no?

Read full topic

item.title: Custom resolution
item.dc:creator: @someone2 someone2
item.description:
@someone2 wrote:

It’s not something you can easily do. You’d have to mod your graphics drivers.

Read full topic

item.title: Custom resolution
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Loveandpower:

That’s what I thought but how do I go about making a custom resolution? My graphics driver does not have a “make a special resolution” option

It’s more difficult than that.

The only thing I can think of is pick the closest resolution, and then program the graphics card to clip the outer edges to black.

Why would you want such a thing?

Read full topic

item.title: Custom resolution
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

That’s what I thought but how do I go about making a custom resolution? My graphics driver does not have a “make a special resolution” option

item.title: Custom resolution
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

if the desired resolution is within the same scale, yes
